article:
My old college roommate, Bob, was no ordinary person. In the first  _ , he did not come from an ordinary family, both his parents were famous. His father was a chess expert and rocket research    _  for NASA. His mother had been an opera singer in Europe.  However , what made Bob unusual was _  his parents were famous, he had  _  interest in school---he never studied and avoided(;) activities that  _ thinking. In general, he was quite different from his parents. In fact, you might think Bob was rather stupid,  _  you asked a question about a car. When it came to working with or knowing about cars, Bob was a genius ! He could take a car  _ , put it back together again,  _  any mechanical  difficulty, or give you the correct statistics for any American car built in the last 20 years. There was  very little  he did not know about  them . That was what made Bob so unusual.
After six months of college, he  _  all his classes and had to drop out. He left the school. After  _ , he got a job in a garage   working with  _ . In the end, I think he was secretly  _  that he had to leave school.
